```diff
-         {{ if .Date }}

+         {{ if .Params.author }}
+         &lt;div class=&quot;article-byline&quot;&gt;
+             By {{ .Params.author }} • {{ if .Date }}{{ .Date.Format &quot;January 2, 2006&quot; }}{{ end }}
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+         {{ else if .Date }}
+         &lt;div class=&quot;article-byline&quot;&gt;
              {{ .Date.Format &quot;January 2, 2006&quot; }}
-         &lt;/time&gt;
+         &lt;/div&gt;
          {{ end }}
+         &lt;h1&gt;{{ .Title }}&lt;/h1&gt;
      &lt;/header&gt;
      
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---


Updated the article template to show the author name and date at the top in the format "By [name] • [date]".

The change is in `themes/majority/layouts/_default/single.html`. The byline appears above the article title in the header. If an article has an author, it shows "By [author] • [date]"; if there's no author but there's a date, it shows just the date.

I interpreted "9dot)" as "•" (bullet point). If you meant a different separator, say so and I can update it.

The template will display the author from the front matter (e.g., "sparkzilla", "AngusRobinson") and the formatted date at the top of each article.

<details><summary>Tool use: **command** • Run command: cd content/posts; Select-String -Pattern '^author\s*=' -Path *.md | ForEach-Object { $_.Line } | Sort-Object -Unique</summary>

```bash
cd content/posts; Select-String -Pattern '^author\s*=' -Path *.md | ForEach-Object { $_.Line } | Sort-Object -Unique
```

Updating the template to use the author mapping:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: themes/majority/layouts/_default/single.html</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 4, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -3,6 +3,9 @@
      &lt;header class=&quot;article-header&quot;&gt;
          {{ if .Params.author }}
+         {{ $authorUsername := .Params.author }}
+         {{ $authorName := index .Site.Data.authors $authorUsername }}
+         {{ if not $authorName }}{{ $authorName = $authorUsername }}{{ end }}
          &lt;div class=&quot;article-byline&quot;&gt;
-             By {{ .Params.author }} • {{ if .Date }}{{ .Date.Format &quot;January 2, 2006&quot; }}{{ end }}
+             By {{ $authorName }} • {{ if .Date }}{{ .Date.Format &quot;January 2, 2006&quot; }}{{ end }}
          &lt;/div&gt;
          {{ else if .Date }}
```

</details>

---



---


Updated the template to use real names instead of usernames.

1. **Created an author mapping file** (`data/authors.yaml`) that maps usernames (like "sparkzilla") to display names (like "Mark Devlin"), using the WordPress export data.

2. **Updated the template** (`themes/majority/layouts/_default/single.html`) to:
   - Look up the author username in the mapping file
   - Use the display name if found, otherwise fall back to the username
   - Display "By [real name] • [date]" at the top of each article

Articles now show "By Mark Devlin • March 20, 2023" instead of "By sparkzilla • March 20, 2023". The mapping covers all authors found in your posts. If a username isn't in the mapping, it falls back to the username.

---
